name: reweave
content:
reweave verb [T]
(COMBINE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to form something new from several different things, or to combine several different things in a new way: Expansion of the programme would begin to reweave the social safety net for the 21st century. Between them they re-wove the fabric of horse racing in this country.
More examplesFewer examplesHis art reminds us that the threads binding a civilized society can be rewoven. We all re-weave our messy lives into palatable histories.

reweave verb [T]
(REPAIR)
to repair cloth by repeatedly crossing a single thread through two sets of long threads : Holes in sweaters can be rewoven or mended. Restorers re-wove the linen fabric in places where there were holes.
